Title: (Updated) Entra ID: Upcoming changes to support passkey profiles in the authentication methods policy (preview)
Tags: Updated message, Feature update, User impact, Admin impact, Retirement
Summary: In November 2025, Microsoft Entra ID will support passkey profiles in public preview, enabling group-based passkey configurations and new API schema changes. Rollout occurs worldwide early November to December and mid-November to mid-December for GCC environments. No admin action is needed before rollout.

Title: (Updated) Action Required: Update active Exchange Web Services Applications
Summary: Exchange Web Services (EWS) in Exchange Online will be blocked starting October 1, 2026. Organizations must migrate active EWS applications to Microsoft Graph, Power Platform, or Copilot Declarative Agents. Most EWS apps can already be safely migrated despite some parity gaps. Begin modernization now.

Title: Secure Boot certificate deployment guide and tools
Plan for Change: Intune Company Portal app for iOS/iPadOS minimum required version changing to v5.2509.2 in November
Summary: The Intune Company Portal app for iOS/iPadOS will require version 5.2509.2 by November 15, 2025. Most users will update automatically, but those with the "Block installing apps using App Store" restriction must have updates pushed manually. Prepare by informing helpdesk if needed.

Title: The October 2025 Windows security update is now available
Windows 11, version 22H2 (Enterprise & Education editions) has reached end of servicing
Windows 10 has reached end of support
Protect your Windows 10 devices after Microsoft support ends
Summary: Microsoft ends Windows 10 support on October 14, 2025, stopping security updates and technical support. Microsoft Defender will still offer limited protection. To stay secure, upgrade to Windows 11 or use the Extended Security Update (ESU) program if upgrading isnâ€™t immediately possible. Review compliance needs accordingly.

Title: Microsoft Defender for Office 365: Enhancing the quarantine experience for administrators
Tags: Feature update, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: Microsoft Defender for Office 365 is enhancing quarantine for admins by listing messages by individual recipients, improving backend durability, and maintaining existing cmdlets with adjusted functionality. Rollout starts November 2025. No changes affect end users. Admins should update practices and documentation accordingly.

Title: Hotpatch efficiency unlocked: Smaller update size
Activation keys for Windows 10 Extended Security Update might be incorrect
30-Day Reminder: Windows 11, version 23H2 (Home and Pro editions) will reach end of servicing on November 11, 2025
Exchange ActiveSync TLS 1.3 Certificate Based Authentication Change
Summary: Exchange ActiveSync Certificate-Based Authentication now supports TLS 1.3, routing traffic to new tenant-location-based endpoints. Most clients will redirect seamlessly, but organizations using Secure Email Gateways may need to update firewall settings. Rollout began globally, expanding to other clouds by November 2025.

Title: Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps: Improvements to threat protection capabilities
Tags: Feature update, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps will expand its dynamic threat detection model in November 2025, replacing legacy policies with more accurate, research-driven detections. This update improves threat detection accuracy and responsiveness, requires no admin action before rollout, and includes new detections enabled by default.
